class.name: TrackedChange
class.description: Represents a tracked change in a Word document.

properties.name: author
properties.description: Gets the author of the tracked change.

examples.description: Get and display the author name of the first tracked change in the document

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a tracked change to load and read its properties, then display the author who made the change.

properties.name: date
properties.description: Gets the date of the tracked change.

examples.description: Display the date when each tracked change was made in the document by showing an alert with the dates of all tracked changes.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Gets the text of the tracked change.

examples.description: Get and display the text content of the first tracked change in the document

properties.name: type
properties.description: Gets the type of the tracked change.

examples.description: Get all tracked changes in the document and display an alert showing the type of each tracked change (whether it's an addition, deletion, or formatting change).
Accept the first tracked change in the document body.

methods.name: getNext
methods.description: Gets the next tracked change. Throws an ItemNotFound error if this tracked change is the last one.

examples.description: Retrieve the second tracked change in the document body and load its author, date, text, and type properties.

methods.name: getNextOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the next tracked change. If this tracked change is the last one, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see [OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

examples.description: Iterate through all tracked changes in the document and log their text content to the console.

methods.name: getRange
methods.description: Gets the range of the tracked change.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the text content of the range associated with the first tracked change in the document body.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Get and display the author and date of the first tracked change in the document
Reject the first tracked change in the document body.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.TrackedChange object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.TrackedChangeData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a tracked change to JSON format to log or store its properties for debugging purposes

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a tracked change object to monitor its properties across multiple sync calls and ensure it remains valid when accessed outside the initial batch operation.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Get a tracked change from the document, perform operations with it, then untrack it to free memory resources when done.
